books.title: Alice in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: Alice in Wonderland is a fantasy novel written by Lewis Carroll. The story follows the adventures of Alice, a young girl who falls down a rabbit hole and finds herself in a strange and wonderful world. She encounters eccentric characters such as the Mad Hatter and the Cheshire Cat, and must navigate through absurd trials to find her way. The book has become a classic of children's literature and has captivated readers of all ages since its publication.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: 1984 is a dystopian fiction novel by George Orwell. It is set in a totalitarian society where the government, led by the omnipresent Big Brother, controls every aspect of people's lives. The story follows Winston Smith, a man who rebels against the oppressive regime and seeks truth and freedom. The novel is a chilling exploration of surveillance, censorship, and the power of the state.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: Pride and Prejudice is a romance novel by Jane Austen. The story follows the lively Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates the societal expectations of 19th-century England. The novel explores themes of love, class, and personal growth, and is celebrated for its wit and social commentary.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: The Hobbit is a fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien. It follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is reluctantly thrust into an epic quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the fearsome dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo encounters elves, dwarves, and goblins, and discovers courage and resourcefulness within himself.
